channel.title: MSDN Just Published
channel.description: Keep current with all the new technical articles, columns, specifications, and resources published on the Microsoft Developer Network (MSDN).

item.title: That's Totally Disco
item.description: Clint Rutkas describes his months-long quest to create a party dance floor for him and his friends to enjoy by combining his MacGyver-like talents with hardware and Visual C#.
item.dc:creator: Clint Rutkas

item.title: Building a WPF Sudoku Game Part 2: The Board UI and Validation
item.description: In his second tutorial, Lucas Magder covers developing a custom control for the Sudoku board and databinding it to the game logic, using the advanced databinding features found in Windows Presentation Foundation.
item.dc:creator: Lucas Magder

item.title: Speed Development With Custom Application Blocks For Enterprise Library
item.description: Learn how to build your own application block that integrates with the patterns & practices Enterprise Library application blocks.
item.dc:creator: Mark Seemann

item.title: ASP.NET Atlas Powers the AJAX-Style Sites You’ve Been Waiting For
item.description: See how Atlas allows you to build AJAX-Style sites with this upcoming technology from ASP.NET.
item.dc:creator: Matt Gibbs

item.title: Tutorial 1: Creating a Data Access Layer
item.description: When building a Web application creating the DAL should be one of your first steps, occurring before you start creating your presentation layer. With Visual Studio, creating a DAL based on Typed DataSets is a task you can accomplish in 10-15 minutes.
item.dc:creator: Scott Mitchell

item.title: The ADO.NET Entity Framework Overview - Making the Conceptual Level Real
item.description: Eliminate the impedance mismatch between data models and between languages that application developers would otherwise have to deal with with new features available in the upcoming version of ADO.NET.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft

item.title: Next-Generation Data Access: Making the Conceptual Level Real
item.description: Eliminate the impedance mismatch for both applications and data services like reporting, analysis, and replication offered as part of the SQL Server product by raising the level of abstraction from the logical level to the conceptual level.
item.dc:creator: José Blakeley; David Campbell; Jim Gray; S. Muralidhar; Anil Nori

item.title: Learn about Visual Studio Code Name "Orcas"
item.description: Find out more about Visual Studio Code Name “Orcas”, the upcoming release of Visual Studio for Windows Vista and the 2007 Office System.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft

item.title: Best Practices: Using Disposable Windows SharePoint Services Objects
item.description: Learn the appropriate ways to write your code when using Microsoft Windows SharePoint Services objects so that you can avoid retaining the objects in memory with the Microsoft .NET Framework.
item.dc:creator: Mike Ammerlan, Scott Harris

item.title: Code Security Changes in Outlook 2007
item.description: Microsoft Office Outlook 2007 enhances code security to help protect Outlook users against malicious code while reducing security warnings for developers and users. Find out how these changes make developing and using Outlook solutions easier while mainta
item.dc:creator: Ryan Gregg

item.title: Outlook 2007 Sample Add-ins: Rules Add-in, Travel Agency Add-in, and Prepare for Meeting Add-in
item.description: Outlook 2007 introduces many enhancements to its object model that enable you to create richer solutions. Three sample add-ins, the Rules add-in, Travel Agency add-in, and Prepare for Meeting add-in are available in both Visual Basic .NET and C#.
item.dc:creator: Randy Byrne; Ryan Gregg

item.title: Walkthrough: Word 2007 XML Format
item.description: Walk through the new default file format for Microsoft Office Word 2007. Read detailed descriptions of the file format architecture, key components, and ways in which you can programmatically modify content.
item.dc:creator: Erika Ehrli

item.title: Windows Communication Foundation Bindings and Channels
item.description: Clemens Vasters explains what "bindings" are and how they control the construction of the Windows Communication Foundation channel stack at runtime and what that channel stack is to begin with.
item.dc:creator: Clemens Vasters

item.title: Hosting the InfoPath 2007 Form Editing Environment in a Custom Web Form
item.description: Learn how to use the XmlFormView ASP.NET control, together with InfoPath Forms Services, to create custom Web pages to render Web-enabled, interactive InfoPath forms.
item.dc:creator: Mike Talley

item.title: .NET Rocks! - Michael Stiefel Gets Us Into the Windows Workflow
item.description: Michael Stiefel talks to us about what the Windows Workflow Foundation is and why we want to use it.
item.dc:creator: Carl Franklin

item.title: Video Game Development: Learn to Write C# the Fun Way
item.description: Learn a fun way to write in C#! Instructors from the DigiPen Institute of Technology introduce participants to the concepts of 3-D video game production in this on-demand webcast series.

item.title: Keep Sites Running Smoothly By Avoiding These 10 Common ASP.NET Pitfalls
item.description: Read about 10 of the pitfalls that can litter the path to releasing your production ASP.NET applications, and what you can do to avoid them.
item.dc:creator: Jeff Prosise

item.title: Project Glidepath public beta has launched!
item.description: Visit http://www.projectglidepath.net to participate in the Microsoft MicroISV Evangelism program that delivers an in-Visual-Studio experience providing the workflow-based guidance, sample code and technology to create applications for Windows Vista.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft

item.title: 12 Finalists Announced in $10,000 Made in Express Contest
item.description: What do an all terrain self-maneuverable robot, an instant IM translator, and a curmudgeon chat bot all have in common? Answer – they are all being built by finalists in the Made In Express Contest. Check out these cool projects!

item.title: Get Your Applications Ready for Windows Vista
item.description: DevReadiness.org is the developer community site to help you get your applications ready for Windows Vista. Learn how to test your application for Windows Vista, and find simple remedies to fix the most common issues.

item.title: Introducing .NET Framework 3.0
item.description: Vice President S. Somasegar describes the decision to rename WinFX to the .NET Framework 3.0. Now the WinFX technology you know has a name that identifies it for exactly what it is – the next version of Microsoft’s developer framework.
item.dc:creator: S. Somasegar

item.title: Identity and Access Management Center
item.description: This center collects the most current information, tools and technology downloads, articles, media, and communities to aid developers in design, development, and testing of identity-aware, directory-enabled applications.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: Refactoring in Visual Basic 2005
item.description: Jay Schmelzer talks about source code refactoring and provides a demo of Refactor! for Visual Basic 2005, a free tool from Developer Express, Inc. that adds refactoring support to the Visual Basic 2005 development environment.
item.dc:creator: Jay Schmelzer

item.title: The .NET Developer’s Guide to Identity
item.description: A roadmap for developers and architects who want to learn how to build identity-aware applications on the Windows platform. From authentication and authorization to federated identity, you’ll discover techniques that can be used today and in the future.
item.dc:creator: Keith Brown

item.title: Microsoft Visual Studio Team Edition for Software Developers
item.description: Describes the features available in Microsoft Visual Studio Team Edition for Software Developers for improving code quality.
item.dc:creator: Eric Lee Microsoft Corporation
item.category: Visual Studio 2005 Team Edition for Software Developers

item.title: Customize the Visual Studio 2005 Debugger Display of Your Data
item.description: Calvin Hsia illustrates ways to customize the Visual Studio 2005 Debugger to get the most out of your debugging time.
item.dc:creator: Calvin Hsia

item.title: Beyond Membership: Using the Provider Design Pattern For Custom Features
item.description: ASP.NET 2.0 offers an abstract membership API for adding authentication and membership management functionality to your applications with the Provider Pattern. Aaron Murrell shows how to implement it.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Murrell

item.title: Identity and Access Management
item.description: The Identity and Access Management site features the most current information, tools/technology downloads, articles, media, and communities to aid developers in their design, development, and testing of identity-aware, directory-enabled applications.
item.dc:creator: Microsoft Corporation

item.title: .NET Rocks! - Brian Randell Checks In on Virtualization
item.description: Brian Randell talks about Virtual Machines today and tomorrow, and boasts a bit about his new monster of a machine. The discussion also touches on the rift between Microsoft and Adobe over PDF support in Office "12".
item.dc:creator: Carl Franklin

item.title: Join our slow chat on Visual C++
item.description: During the week of June 19th, the Visual C++ team will be hosting a slow chat titled "Visual C++: Yesterday, Today and Tomorrow" on CodeGuru (www.codeguru.com). For this slow chat we’ll be discussing the history & evolution of Visual C++. Please join us!
item.dc:creator: Microsoft
